oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Telegram sent to Dr. John Walter Morris from Queen Elizabeth
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Dr. John Walter Morris attended Vanderbilt Medical School and was commissioned into the US Army Reserve Medical Corps in 1916. Upon America's entry into the World War I, he was detached to the 42nd Royal Highland Regt., The Black Watch, a British unit. Wounded and captured at Ypres, Belgium in March 1918 he remained a POW until the war ended. He returned to practice medicine in Somerville and became mayor.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
